dev/lsf/algorithm/two_dimensional_table.hpp

00001 // File:        two_dimensional_table.hpp
00002 // Description: ---
00003 // Notes:       ---
00004 // Author:      leoxiang <leoxiang727@qq.com>
00005 // Revision:    2015-11-09 by leoxiang
00006 
00007 #pragma once
00008 #include <vector>
00009 #include <string>
00010 #include <fstream>
00011 #include <stdexcept>
00012 #include <sstream>
00013 #include "lsf/util/string_ext.hpp"
00014 #include "lsf/basic/error.hpp"
00015 #include "lsf/basic/type_cast.hpp"
00016 
00017 namespace lsf {
00018 namespace algorithm {
00019 
00020 template<typename ElemType>
00021 class TwoDimensionalTable :
00022     public std::vector<std::vector<ElemType>>,
00023     public lsf::basic::Error {
00024 public:
00025     using base_type = std::vector<std::vector<ElemType>>;
00026     static const int FIELD_DELIMIT = ',';
00027 
00028 public:
00029     // util func
00030     std::string ToString(size_t off) {
00031         auto& vec = base_type::at(off);
00032         std::ostringstream oss;
00033         for (auto& field : vec) {
00034             oss << field << ",";
00035         }
00036         return oss.str();
00037     }
00038 
00039     ElemType Get(size_t voff, size_t hoff) {
00040         if (voff >= base_type::size()) return ElemType();
00041         if (hoff >= base_type::at(voff).size()) return ElemType();
00042         return base_type::at(voff).at(hoff);
00043     }
00044 
00045     // process config
00046     bool ParseFromFile(std::string const& file_name) {
00047         // open file
00048         std::fstream fs;
00049         fs.open(file_name, std::ios::in);
00050         if (!fs.is_open()) {
00051             SetErrString("open file failed: " + file_name);
00052             return false;
00053         }
00054 
00055         // clear table
00056         base_type::clear();
00057 
00058         // process every line
00059         std::string line;
00060         while (lsf::util::StringExt::SafeGetLine(fs, line)) {
00061             // ignore empty
00062             if (line.empty()) continue;
00063 
00064             // add new line
00065             base_type::emplace_back();
00066             auto& table_line = *base_type::rbegin();
00067 
00068             // traverse every field
00069             size_t pos = 0;
00070             bool has_real_field = false;
00071             do  {
00072                 std::string field = lsf::util::StringExt::SplitGetNext(line, (char)FIELD_DELIMIT, pos);
00073                 lsf::util::StringExt::RemoveHeadWhitespace(field);
00074                 lsf::util::StringExt::RemoveTailWhitespace(field);
00075                 // handle throws
00076                 try {
00077                     table_line.push_back(lsf::basic::TypeCast<ElemType>(field));
00078                 }
00079                 catch (std::invalid_argument const& ia) {
00080                     table_line.emplace_back();
00081                 }
00082                 if (!field.empty()) has_real_field = true;
00083             }
00084             while (pos != std::string::npos);
00085 
00086             // if empty line just ignore
00087             if (!has_real_field) {
00088                 base_type::erase(base_type::end()-1);
00089                 continue;
00090             }
00091         }
00092 
00093         return true;
00094     }
00095 };
00096 
00097 } // end namespace algorithm
00098 } // end namespace lsf
00099
